text:
hi
 i m try to work on HubSpot App marketplace. But I have many problems.
1. I did create App and send CRM, scope and redirect URL but when I call API with client secret here you can seen pic of client secret.
image.png
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U03U52C27BK/F03U592RP9P/image.png>
when id send GET request <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts> with header Authorization (client secret) then API response
`{`
    `"status": "error",`
    `"message": "Authentication credentials not found. This API supports both API Key and OAuth 2.0 authentication and you can find more details at <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/auth/oauth-overview>",`
    `"correlationId": "f2c66b86-54b8-4a3d-b596-0b8a5ec4c2cb",`
    `"category": "INVALID_AUTHENTICATION"`
`}`
so how i can run my app ?
Yes, the account we have been trying is a super admin. Can it be something with the paid plan my client have? Is it possible that not all HubSpot admins have access to these scopes?
Also my client app isn't listed in the marketplace yet but I think it is still supposed to be publicly accessible right?
<@U25PYL3Q8>
<#C2YHAHB6K|api> <#C2YH119N2|hubl> <#CCQ7H31D5|developer-tools> How can i access Any HubSpot API without API-KEY please guide me.
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F3Qd9Hp4giM&ab_channel=HubSpotDevelopers>
HubSpot has  three ways of authentication can you let me know about third way also please sir. <@UBT0AHWLD>
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/intro-to-auth#:~:text=There%20are%20three%20ways%20to,access%20tokens%2C%20and%20API%20keys>.

Can you give me a bit more info on what your app/api calls are and that level of HubSpot your client has?

That could be an issue
Use private app Authentication for a private app or use oauth for a public one

It might be worth looking into the boilerplate authentication for oauth. I'm on mobile or I'd look for it. 

I believe the node js HubSpot api wrapper has an example for authentication using oauth. 

You are completing authentication properly, and that is why you aren't able to do your api call

Hey team!
Can I get the company logo through the API? I can't find the name of the property.
Is there REST API endpoint to create a new backup (zip-file), and then get/download the file? Or any other way to create daily backup or just get CRM objects/tables?
<https://skyvia.com/backup/HubSpot-backup>
thanks. but it is 3rd party tool. I am looking to do it manually, scheduled on our server

[ HTTP ERROR 400 - Bad Request ]
hi, everyone!
Can someone find out what I'm doing wrong?
I'm still getting this error for some time (It's my first time using the API). I'm trying to import a sample of contacts (csv file) to sandbox env, just for test.
I'm following *<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/imports|this how-to>* and using the same python code.

Somethings I thought that could be the problem:
1. idColumnType: not sure if it's required for all fields
    a. using the same python code from the tutorial, the null wouldn't work once it isnt defined. I also tried "null" and None for firstname and lastname.
thank you!

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/settings/account-information-api>

this? I’m not sure….

try creating a new table and just do a basic update of that and see if that works.?

are you using tableid for both?

are you using some node wrapper or are you doing direct updates via a url?

I did create another table and used the example request on the API docs just to make sure, but if the request was the issue would it still show as ID not found? Yes, using the table ID for both calls. Have tried using the HubSpot Api Client, a custom client as well as a REST client app to make direct calls and all show the same error.
yeah, that doesn’t make any sense to me at alll
Hi there anyone else experiencing v1 getAllContacts returning an empty result set?
